text: - Hey, I'm Shane from Amazon SageMaker.
We're here at Generative AI Day.
A lot of people are doing a lot of cool stuff.
We're hearing phenomenal things
in the keynotes and the breakouts.
And I'm actually here to talk to Chris.

Chris, can you tell a little
bit more about yourself?
- Yeah, I'm Chris.

I've been working in
selling partner experience
for the last two years,

trying to figure out how we
can leverage generative AI

to really simplify the
experience of selling on Amazon.
- Fantastic.
Well, gen AI is a passion of mine,

being on SageMaker working
with the Bedrock team.
But tell me a bit about yourself

and more about the selling
partner experience.
And Project Amelia.

I mean, it sounds
amazing from what I read.
- Oh, we're so excited about it.
Well, first of all, let me say,

I've been doing machine
learning for about 17 years
and 10 of those years at Amazon.
Amazon has a long history
of leveraging machine learning and AI
to delight our customers

and to create powerful
experience for our sellers.

And selling partner
experience is a team of people
who are focused on
making navigating global eCommerce easy.

That may sound kind of hard
to wrap your head around

because, think about all the
things that go into that,
whether it's figuring out
how to position your brands to customers,

how to figure out how
to get your inventory
into their hands

and at the speeds that
Amazon is famous for,
how to deal with product compliance
in marketplaces around the world.
This is complicated stuff,

but our job is to use
technology to make that easy

so that anyone, any small
business can take an idea

and turn it into a product
and give it to the world.
And we're really excited to do that.

And we think generative AI and
Project Amelia in particular
is a great way to do that.

And, essentially, Project
Amelia is a generative AI system
that will be right along a seller's side

as they're navigating
their selling journey,
helping them, answering their questions,
doing things on their behalf,
to simplify that experience.
- Chris, that's fantastic.
And, you know, as you go through that,

it really sounds like everything
that you've been doing
and the team's been doing
for the selling partner experience,

gen AI is just taking
it to the next level.

- That's right.
- Right?

And you're really able
to use that technology
and leverage the technology
to really empower and impact sellers.
Can you tell me a little bit more
about that gen AI experience
and kind of how you got there
and how you moved from that POC
to production and where you are today?
- Sure.
So of course we've been building tools

to help sellers be successful
in their business on Amazon
for a very long time.

Those tools, they live in a
place called Seller Central,

and so that's a primary
ingress for doing this.

There's also a mobile app
is another way to do that.
In any case, doing that
and getting access to all those tools,
anybody can do it.

You could sign up right now
and start selling on Amazon.
What we realized when,

two years ago we started to
see this technology come out,
is that it offered an opportunity
to help sellers understand

how to use all of that
technology, all of those tools.
It was a way to simplify,

to have essentially a system
that's right there by your side
that you can talk to in your own language,
that understands you and your business
and can help you kind of do any aspect

of the selling on Amazon journey
that is important to you.

And so the way it works is
you go into Seller Central,

and you might start
searching for something,

and you see this option to
work with this assistant.
And it will pop out as a sidebar,

and then you can start
essentially talking to it.
It will give you advice,
it knows about your sales, your traffic,
and we see so much opportunity for it
to essentially be your business partner.
- That's fantastic.
So what it sounds like is, you know,
you mentioned anybody can do it.
- Yeah.

- And it's not just for
big enterprise sellers

or large corporations that
are selling on Amazon,

it's really making it
approachable to any seller.

- So a lot of what we
hear on the gen AI space
is it's not approachable, right?
And I love the idea
that you're making this approachable,
using generative AI to do that.

What tools did you use
to get to that point
where you can make it
approachable and simple for any seller?
- Sure.
So first of all, again,

we've been using machine
learning for so long.
We know it in and out.

And of course we've been using
the tools of AWS all along.

We've used SageMaker since
it was first released.
It's been a great tool.
If you have scientists

who are building powerful
ML and AI models,
it's a great way to get out there.
What we saw with gen AI is,
we saw the investment in Bedrock from AWS,
which now makes it possible
to actually package these tools together.
Whether you have a big team of scientists
who are doing research

and really exploring the
forefront of this technology, or,
and we do this too,
you see some opportunity

and you have maybe an
engineer or a product manager
who says, "I wonder if I could do that."

And you just quickly
start using this tooling
and you start, you know, making an impact.
And that's what we want to do.
That's what we have been doing internally.
That's what we want
our sellers to be able to do with Amelia.
- Fantastic.

And you talked about getting
started easily for any seller.

And I wonder, what are
some of the benefits

your customers have observed
with Project Amelia?
- Well, so we're in the early days,
we're just starting to ramp up.
We're out as beta to a group of users.

But some of the things that
I see are, for example,

I was watching a seller who
was trying to understand
a particular fee that they had gotten.
And they took the language of the fee,
and they said, "I still don't get this.
"What is this?"
And they copied it in.

And so our assistant
then explained to them,
"Well, this is the policy,
"and here is why, in your particular case,

"you know, these things have
happened and these fees apply."
And the seller was amazed.
They're like, "Oh, that policy,
"now I understand how it works.
"This thing has actually opened up for me
"something that really makes a difference
"in how I understand my business."

And most importantly is
when you start having

that kind of communication
with the seller,
they can optimize for their business.
That's good for them,
that's good for the buying customers,
that's good for Amazon.
We all win together with this technology
because it means that sellers

are finding just the
ways to be successful.

- It sounds like you're just
accelerating that time for them
to get over that learning curve
and to really start to be able
to drive their business forward.
- That's right.
- So what key lessons
have you learned throughout this journey?

I know you've been doing
machine learning a long time.
gen AI is the next evolution, right?
The acceleration.
What key lessons have you learned
as you've started with Project Amelia

and really leveraging gen AI
over the last couple years?
- Gosh, a lot.
It's been quite the whirlwind.
And, you know, one thing is,
and I think this is the thing
that's very exciting for many people,
is that you can move fast.

So when I was doing machine
learning development

before all of this came
about in the last two years,
the typical kind of pattern
for a machine learning scientist

was you spend months trying
to find the data that you need

that's relevant to the problem
you're trying to solve,
you think very carefully

about how to frame that
problem as a business problem,
then you massage that data into a way

that makes the most of
a particular algorithm,
and you explore the different algorithms.
This was a multi-month,
often, year-long cycle of development.

And now the beautiful thing
about foundation models
is that they're kind of the pinnacle
of what we would call transfer learning.
They can just naturally adapt
to different types of problems.

And so that means that you
don't have to have scientists

spending months going through
this very complex process
to get to a business outcome.
Instead, you leverage the tools
that you can find in Bedrock
to drive that impact in weeks sometimes.
And I've seen that happen.
So that's a good learned.
That's a good one, yeah, yeah.
- You know, one of the thing,
kind of just a side tangent there,

you know, one of the things
we also take a look at
is the choice and flexibility of models.

- Yeah.
- Right?

And, you know, we talk
about that story a lot
from the gen AI perspective,
from the Bedrock perspective.

But I'm wondering, as
you're starting to test

and learn how the model
choice for foundation models

kind of plays into how
you're testing learning

and what that means to
you to be able to do that.
- Well, I think you're going
kind of in a power user direction here,
which I would say is,
and this is a great thing about Bedrock,
is there are times

when you need a really
sophisticated, powerful model.
And there are times

when you might want to
have a much smaller model
but made to a particular situation.
And actually I think, you know,
we talk a lot now about
these kind of multi-agent frameworks
where you use the right kind of model
for different purposes.
That's something

that we're very interested
in and invested in.

But I think the idea is
that as a business owner,
you want to figure out
how to combine different capabilities,

and you can do that based
on the cost of those models,
the speed, the complexity of the task
you're trying to solve.

This is one of the things that
I think is really critical,
a critical value-add for Bedrock
is that to be really effective

and like use this to
the best of its power,
you have to figure out that mix,

that way of bringing those
different capabilities
and different levels of models together.

- So, Chris, the reason I
ask about the models is,
gen AI is changing so rapidly every day.

There's new opportunities, new
tools, new things to learn,

and new things to innovate
to bring to customers.
So the obvious question is, what's next?

- Well, what I'm excited
to do is go find out.

And this is really part
of the story of gen AI

and certainly part of the
story of Project Amelia.
We see so much opportunity.
We know that we're going to change
what it means to sell on Amazon

and empower all of these
sellers to do great things.

What we've got out there
right now is really powerful,
but it's just the beginning.
And we're going to learn as we go.

We're going to learn
directly from the sellers
as they're using Project Amelia.
They're going to tell us what they want,

and that's going to drive
the product roadmap,
that's going to drive the science.
I think what we're going to see

is a reshaping of what it looks
like to do global eCommerce,
where it's empowering,
where essentially anybody with an idea

can operate like a
multinational corporation,

able to do whatever is kind
of in their minds, innovate.
And I'm super excited to figure out
how to empower them to do that.
- That's fantastic.
I think one last question, Chris, is,
I've asked you a lot of questions.

- Yeah.
- Is there anything you want
or we should know about Project Amelia

that I didn't ask you?
- Well, sure.
There's so much, right?

First of all, and I think this
bears on what you just said,
there's so much more to come.

We want our selling
partners to look at this
as a journey that we're on with them.
I mean, this is the whole story of gen AI,

is that it's changing
how we look at the world,
it's enabling people

to do things they never
thought they could do before.
And so we are learning this together.
And so I want our users,

our selling partners who
are getting out there,
I want them to try it,

and then I want them to
tell us what they want.

And I think we're going to
figure that out together.

So I think that's absolutely
the number one thing
is I'm excited about this journey

and I'm excited to learn
what our sellers need,
and then I want to go build it for 'em.

- That's awesome.
- Yeah.
- Fantastic, Chris, thank you so much.
I really appreciate the time.
- Thanks, Shane, that was great.
- Thank you.
